column4: Hello, my sound won't play and there are two cards in /proc/asound/cards, but the first one is invalid and it only shows up as usb capture in alsamixer.  How can I activate the second card, or remove the first one?
if you go to System->Preferences->Sound can you change to "working" sound card there?
I am not running graphically and there is no monitor...
install alsa-tools and that should give you alsaconf
I installed alsa-tools and I can't figure out how to run alsa-tools or alsaconf
apt-get install alsa-tools;  alsa-tools is already the newest version.
ok type asoundcard list
when I run "asoundconf list" it shows the two cards, I wish to get rid of the first one or activate the second one
oh i';m on edgy... yah could be
did the syntax i give you work?
so um how do I upgrade asoundconf to your version
well i'm runny ubuntu edgy
I upgraded package alsa-utils and now I see set-default-card option
yeah the infinity symbol is there not MM
cool, do you have speakers to test sound?
yes there is a speaker hooked up, but it is a couple miles away at the office... I am pretty sure it works if aplay works.  thanks
awsome
crap it still gives that error when i run as normal user.. it only works as root.  and i changed all the permissions on /dev/snd
hmm user in the audio group?
yes, the default user is in /etc/group:audio:29
oh I had to run asoundconf set-default-card again as that user.  what good is root then
